title: Department of the Environment and Energy
text:
The Department of the Environment and Energy (DEE) was an <a href="Government%20of%20Australia">Australian government</a> <a href="Government%20department">department</a> in existence between 2016 and 2020.
The department was responsible for matters including environment protection and conservation of biodiversity as well as energy policy. It was established in July 2016 by the <a href="Turnbull%20Government">Turnbull Government</a> after the <a href="2016%20Australian%20federal%20election">2016 federal election</a>.
Following the appointment of <a href="Scott%20Morrison">Scott Morrison</a> as <a href="Prime%20Minister">Prime Minister</a>, <a href="Josh%20Frydenberg">Josh Frydenberg</a> was elevated to <a href="Treasurer%20of%20Australia">Treasurer of Australia</a>, whereby Frydenberg's previous ministerial positions were separated, with <a href="Melissa%20Price%20%28politician%29">Melissa Price</a> as <a href="Minister%20of%20the%20Environment%20%28Australia%29">Minister of the Environment</a> and <a href="Angus%20Taylor%20%28politician%29">Angus Taylor</a> as Minister for Energy. Price was reshuffled from her position in 2019, and was replaced by <a href="Sussan%20Ley">Sussan Ley</a>.
By an administrative order issued on 5 December 2019 and effective from 1 February 2020, the environment functions of the department were merged with all functions of the <a href="Department%20of%20Agriculture%20%28Australia%2C%202019%E2%80%9320%29">Department of Agriculture</a>, to form the <a href="Department%20of%20Agriculture%2C%20Water%20and%20the%20Environment">Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment</a>. The department's energy functions were transferred to the <a href="Department%20of%20Industry%2C%20Science%2C%20Energy%20and%20Resources">Department of Industry, Science, Energy and Resources</a>.
Scope.
The <a href="Machinery%20of%20government%23Australian%20Government%20Administrative%20Arrangement%20Orders">Administrative Arrangements Orders</a> listed the department's responsibilities as follows:
Structure.
The head of the department was its <a href="Departmental%20secretary">Secretary</a>, <a href="Finn%20Pratt">Finn Pratt</a> , responsible to the <a href="Minister%20for%20the%20Environment%20and%20Energy">Minister for the Environment and Energy</a>, <a href="The%20Honourable">the Hon.</a> <a href="Melissa%20Price%20%28politician%29">Melissa Price</a> until 2019, and then <a href="The%20Honourable">the Hon.</a> <a href="Sussan%20Ley">Sussan Ley</a> . The department was staffed by individuals from the <a href="Australian%20Public%20Service">Australian Public Service</a>.
Online databases and apps.
, the DEE website also hosted the <a href="Australasian%20Underwater%20Cultural%20Heritage%20Database">Australasian Underwater Cultural Heritage Database</a> (AUCHD), a searchable online <a href="database">database</a> containing data about <a href="shipwrecks">shipwrecks</a>, <a href="aircraft">aircraft</a> and other cultural heritage <a href="Cultural%20artifact">artefacts</a> which are or have been underwater. The AUCHD also served as the register of protected underwater cultural heritage for the "<a href="Underwater%20Cultural%20Heritage%20Act%202018">Underwater Cultural Heritage Act 2018</a>" (the UCH Act), providing a means whereby the public could submit notifications and permit applications required under the Act.
The website also hosted a number of other databases and <a href="web%20application">application</a>s in the areas of <a href="biodiversity">biodiversity</a>, <a href="climate%20change">climate change</a>, <a href="cultural%20heritage">heritage</a>, the "<a href="Environment%20Protection%20and%20Biodiversity%20Conservation%20Act%201999">Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act 1999</a>" (EPBC Act), <a href="environmental%20protection">environmental protection</a>, land and water, as well as photo galleries of Australian plants, and environmental and cultural heritage subjects.
